verb.description: To team again; to form into a new team or teams. In later use chiefly: to reunite or team up again (two or more actors, etc.) for a further film; to reunite (an actor, etc.) with another for a further film.
Of a two or more people: to reunite or team up again, especially for a further film. Of one person: to reunite with another, especially for a further film.

origin: Early 20th century; earliest use found in Documents City Boston, 1902. From re- + team.
